retrieved_context:
name: Climate Change
type: Environmental Phenomenon
description: Climate change refers to significant changes in global temperatures and weather patterns over time, primarily caused by human activities such as the burning of fossil fuels. name: Increased Reliance on Pesticides
type: Agricultural Practice
description: Greater use of pesticides to combat pests and diseases in crops under environmental stress. name: Negative Environmental Consequences
type: Environmental Impact
description: Negative environmental consequences can include soil degradation, water pollution, and harm to non-target species. name: Food Shortages
type: Economic Impact
description: Food shortages occur when there is a significant lack of food available for consumption, leading to potential famine and economic instability. name: Water Scarcity
type: Environmental Condition
description: A lack of sufficient available water resources to meet the demands of a region, often exacerbated by climate change. name: More Frequent and Severe Weather Events
type: Weather Phenomenon
description: Rising global temperatures lead to more frequent and severe weather events such as droughts, floods, and heatwaves. name: Destruction of Crops
type: Agricultural Impact
description: Extreme weather events can destroy crops, leading to significant economic losses. name: Shift in Growing Seasons
type: Agricultural Condition
description: Changes in the timing of planting and harvesting seasons due to changing climate conditions. name: pesticides
type: Chemical Substance
description: Pesticides are chemical substances used to control pests, including insects, weeds, and fungi. They are widely used in conventional agriculture but can have negative environmental and health consequences. name: Reduced Crop Yields
type: Agricultural Outcome
description: Reduced crop yields can result from various factors, including the overuse of pesticides and other agricultural practices that degrade soil health. name: climate change
type: Environmental Phenomenon
description: Climate change is a long-term alteration in Earth"s climate and weather patterns. It is primarily driven by human activities, particularly the emission of greenhouse gases. name: Sustainable Water Management
type: Water Management Practice
description: Practices that ensure the efficient and sustainable use of water resources. name: Price Spikes
type: Economic Impact
description: Price spikes refer to sudden increases in the prices of goods, often due to supply chain disruptions or scarcity. name: Climate Change in Agriculture
type: Phenomenon
description: Climate change affects agricultural practices, leading to various environmental and health impacts. name: Pesticides
type: Chemical Substance
description: Substances used to kill or control pests. name: Negative Health Consequences
type: Health Impact
description: Negative health consequences can include acute and chronic health issues for humans, such as respiratory problems, skin irritation, and cancer. name: Expansion of Pests and Diseases
type: Agricultural Condition
description: The spread of pests and diseases that were previously limited to certain regions due to warmer temperatures. name: Decreased Crop Yields
type: Agricultural Impact
description: Reduced crop yields due to environmental stressors such as extreme weather events and increased reliance on pesticides. name: Increased Competition for Water Resources
type: Resource Management
description: Environmental stressors can lead to increased competition for water resources among different sectors, such as agriculture, industry, and domestic use. name: Severe Weather Events
type: Environmental Condition
description: Extreme weather conditions such as droughts, floods, and heatwaves that can devastate crops and reduce yields. name: Disruption of Supply Chains
type: Economic Impact
description: Extreme weather events can disrupt supply chains, affecting food availability and prices. name: Innovation in Agriculture
type: Technological Development
description: The development of new technologies and practices to adapt to changing climate conditions. name: Sustainable Agricultural Practices
type: Agricultural Practice
description: Practices that promote environmental sustainability, such as agroforestry and crop rotation. name: Rising Global Temperatures
type: Environmental Condition
description: An increase in the average temperature of the Earth"s atmosphere and oceans, primarily due to human activities. name: Climate Change on Crops
type: Environmental Impact
description: Climate change can lead to various challenges such as increased temperatures, altered precipitation patterns, and more frequent extreme weather events. name: climate change on crops
type: Environmental Impact
description: The impacts of climate change on crops include altered growing seasons, increased frequency of extreme weather events, and changes in pest and disease dynamics. name: Environmental Consequences
type: Concept
description: Environmental consequences refer to the impacts on the environment resulting from various human activities, particularly those related to climate change and agriculture. name: climate change impacts
type: Phenomenon
description: Climate change impacts include rising temperatures, changing precipitation patterns, and increased frequency of extreme weather events. name: Lower Quality Produce
type: Agricultural Impact
description: Environmental stressors can lead to lower quality produce, affecting market value and consumer satisfaction.

correct_answer: Agriculture is highly dependent on climate conditions.
